column6: The story, of course, is not finished. We end our por¬
tion of it here at a fitting place, at the close of the first
century of the Regiment’s history. But the history of The
Royal Regiment of Canada is an organic thing, which will
continue to be closely interwoven with the fabric of
Canadian life. Indeed, the Regiment remembers its history,
not so much to honour the past as to instruct the future.
The old traditions are recalled not as a valedictory to the
dead but as an admonition to the living.
All the testimony of a hundred years stands surety that
the lesson will be learned well.
Capt Van der SMISSEN, W. H. V.
